title: What is jQuery?

options.b: A fast and concise JavaScript library for HTML manipulation and event handling

title: Who developed jQuery?

options.b: Facebook
options.c: John Resig and the jQuery team

title: What does the '$' symbol represent in jQuery?

options.a: A way to control access to your jQuery application
options.b: An alias for the jQuery object

title: How do you select an element with the ID 'myElement' in jQuery?

options.b: $('#myElement')

title: What is the purpose of the 'document ready' event in jQuery?

options.b: To ensure that the DOM is fully loaded and ready for manipulation

title: How do you set the text content of an element with the class 'myClass' in jQuery?

options.b: $('.myClass').html('New text');

title: What is an 'event handler' in jQuery?

options.a: A way to control access to your jQuery application
options.b: A function that responds to events like clicks or keypresses

title: How do you attach a click event to a button element with the ID 'myButton' in jQuery?

options.b: $('#myButton').click(function() { /* Code here */ });

title: What is the 'chaining' concept in jQuery?

options.b: The practice of calling multiple methods on the same jQuery object in a single statement

title: How do you hide an element with the class 'myElement' in jQuery?

options.b: $('.myElement').display = 'none';

title: What is the 'AJAX' in jQuery used for?

options.a: A way to control access to your jQuery application
options.b: To make asynchronous requests to a server to retrieve or send data without reloading the page

title: What is the 'animate' function in jQuery used for?

options.b: To create custom animations on selected elements

title: How do you include the jQuery library in an HTML document?

options.a: By downloading the jQuery source code and including it in a script tag
options.b: By adding a link to the jQuery CDN in a script tag
options.d: By installing jQuery via npm and importing it into your JavaScript code

title: What is the '$.ajax()' function in jQuery used for?

options.a: A way to control access to your jQuery application
options.b: To make asynchronous HTTP requests using JavaScript

title: How do you select all 'p' elements within a 'div' element with the class 'container' in jQuery?

options.b: $('.container').find('p')

title: What is the purpose of the 'filter' function in jQuery?

options.b: To reduce the set of matched elements to those that match a certain criteria

title: How do you remove an element with the class 'myElement' in jQuery?

options.b: $('.myElement').delete();

title: What is the '$.getJSON()' function in jQuery used for?

options.a: A way to control access to your jQuery application
options.b: To retrieve JSON data from a server using an HTTP GET request

title: What is the 'val()' function in jQuery used for?

options.b: To get or set the value of form elements like input fields and textareas

title: What is the 'hasClass' function in jQuery used for?

options.a: A way to control access to your jQuery application
options.b: To check if an element has a specific class

title: How do you add a CSS class 'active' to an element with the ID 'myElement' in jQuery?

options.b: $('#myElement').css('class', 'active');

title: What is the 'siblings' function in jQuery used for?

options.b: To select all elements that are siblings of the selected element

title: What is 'method chaining' in jQuery?

options.a: A way to control access to your jQuery application
options.b: The practice of calling multiple methods on the same jQuery object one after the other

title: What is the 'each' function in jQuery used for?

options.b: To iterate over a set of matched elements and perform a function for each element

title: How do you prevent the default behavior of a link element with the class 'myLink' in jQuery?

options.b: $('.myLink').disableDefault();

title: What is the 'fadeOut' function in jQuery used for?

options.b: To gradually hide the selected elements by lowering their opacity
